item.title: Continual Learning via Sparse Memory Finetuning
item.description: arXiv:2510.15103v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Modern language models are powerful, but typically static after deployment. A major obstacle to building models that continually learn over time is catastrophic forgetting, where updating on new data erases previously acquired capabilities. Motivated ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, RAG, model, large language model, memory | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Structure-R1: Dynamically Leveraging Structural Knowledge in LLM Reasoning through Reinforcement Learning
item.description: arXiv:2510.15191v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable advances in reasoning capabilities. However, their performance remains constrained by limited access to explicit and structured domain knowledge. Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) addresses ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, RAG, analysis, reasoning, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: AUGUSTUS: An LLM-Driven Multimodal Agent System with Contextualized User Memory
item.description: arXiv:2510.15261v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Riding on the success of LLMs with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), there has been a growing interest in augmenting agent systems with external memory databases. However, the existing systems focus on storing text information in their memory, ign...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> GPT, arxiv, RAG, image, memory | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> RAG, knowledge base, reasoning, model, retrieval | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
